subject: RE: New message from julie arnaud
preview: Hi Julie!  Thank you for your email! We understand it can be frustrating and sorry you were distressed. However it is extremely hard to fit in patients at this time of the year. Dr Kiranbir was happy

full_threads.body:
Hi Julie!


Thank you for your email!
We understand it can be frustrating and sorry you were distressed. However it is extremely hard to fit in patients at this time of the year.
Dr Kiranbir was happy to have a look at it first and relevant treatment appointment would have been organised for you.
According to the notes risk of debonding was explained in October and new bridge suggested.
Please let me know if I can offer you another appointment. Bear in mind it is the busiest month of the year and we try our best to fit in our patients.
Feel free to contact 9432 3400 if you would like to discuss the above.



Kind regards,
Jasmina Ducali



From: DB Dental <support@wpperk.com>
Sent: Friday, 6 December 2019 8:14 PM
To: lynne.devine@nationaldentalcare.com.au; Call Centre <CallCentre@dbdental.com.au>
Subject: New message from julie arnaud


CAUTION: This email originated from outside NDC / DB Dental. Do not click any link or open attachments unless you recognise the sender and know that the content is safe.

You have received a contact for submission from: julie arnaud
Date & Time of Form Submission: 12/06/2019 11:14 pm
Contact Phone: 0450602860
Contact Email: juile.cameron@y7mail.com

Message: Hi,
I am writing to express my great dissapointment in the level of service I have experienced over the last few weeks at the Rockingham DB Clinic.
I have had a false tooth put in place to replace a abcessed root canal and this has come away on one away on 1 occasion and needed to be rebonded. I have been feeling this loosen over the last 3 weeks and made an appointment to have this looked at.

30 minutes before my appointment I was notified that my dentist was sick and I had to push this out another week, there was no other soloution offered to me. I have 2 young children and had organised this appointment around them so that I could attend as this is extremely difficult to bring them in with me for everyone. I then couldnt make the following appointment as my husbund was late from work. I rescheduled one more time to this afternoon at 430 and this was a push to even get this appointment before the christmas break. I was pulling up in the car park when a very rude lady from recpetion called me and advised it was too late as i was 10 minutes late! On my count it was 6 minutes and I tried to explain I had been caught in traffic! I was told i could have it looked at but no treatment would be offered however i could sense the reluctuntess in her voice. My family and I have been loyal customers of DB dental rockingham for nearly 10 years and have always been very happy and reffered others to the clinic . However now I am left with a wobbly false tooth that will come away any day now and no possibility of an appointment before the end of the year.
On each and every occasion I have visited this clinic i have been made to wait on average at least 20 - 30 minutes and sometimes nearly an hour.
So be turned away today as I was 6 minutes late is absoloutely disgusting. The level of customer service is plain wrong.

Needles to say I will be looking for a new dental clinic asap!
Julie Arnaud
